headline: Chef John's Sloppy Joes
description: The secret to a great 'Sloppy Joe' is a thick, rich, almost dry consistency, which allows it to be eaten two-fisted, sans fork.

video.description: See how to make delicious sloppy joes from scratch.
video.name: How To Make Sloppy Joes

name: Chef John's Sloppy Joes
recipeIngredient: 1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the ground beef and onion in a cold skillet, place the skillet onto a stove burner, and turn the heat to medium; cook and stir until the beef is crumbly and browned. Stir the garlic and bell pepper into the beef mixture; continue cooking and stirring until the vegetables are tender, 2 to 3 more minutes. Add 1 cup of water. Mix in ketchup, brown sugar, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire, salt, and pepper. Pour in 1 more cup of water. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook until the mixture becomes very thick, 30 to 45 minutes. Adjust salt and pepper as needed. Season with cayenne.

review.reviewBody: This is the only Sloppy Joe recipe I have used for several years now. We love it . Thanks
Used Beyond Burger and only one cup of water. Consistant winner! Thank you Chef John!

I stuck as close to the written recipe as I could.. (I prefer red pepper and half the brown sugar) and I highly recommend this. I love that it takes longer to cook as I think it helps with the tender beef and happy hour. Thanks.

Love this recipe. It is such a good recipe that even the extra lean turkey I use tastes great! Anyone who says it is too soupy was not patient enough. You really do have to cook it for the full 30-45 minutes. PS - Instead of water try broth or stock.
prepared as directions indicated. yummy, yummy. am making it again right now and looking forward to eating it again.

If you have a big family and double (or triple) the recipe like I did, do not double or triple the water. There is too little surface area to evaporate all the liquid before you cook the rest in to a textureless mush. I made this mistake and and had to scoop out the solids and hard-boil the sauce down before putting the meat and veg back in the pot. The only harm was dirtying a spider and bowl. Next time I will add just enough water to stew the meat but still be reduced enough by the time everything is cooked.
I liked it but my brother said it was just okay

I have always used canned sloppy joe mix since we have a busy household. I feel like I have been missing out! The family absolutely loves this and it is just as fast. Thank you from my house to yours.

Perfect as written thank you . family loves it. For those who say it’s watery be sure to cook moisture out of peppers and onions before adding them back to beef. Low and slow till the right consistency. Well done!

I've made this numerous times for my family. They love it. We're four adult sized people so I always double it (our kids are teens). Plus, everyone likes it as leftovers Tip if you decide to double it(or more)do not double the second "1 cup of water." If you do, you'll be waiting forever for the sauce to reduce. Somewhere between 2 1/2 and 3 cups water total keeps the timing similar.
Easy and delicious

Amazing. Make sure to cook this down to the almost dry consistency described by Chef John. I replaced the fresh onion and garlic with equivalent amounts of dried minced onion and garlic, which worked well and made this a quicker dinner.
Used turkey instead of beef. So good! Delicious recipe!

So dang good! I've made this multiple times and each time, it has come out excellent. For reviewers who say it was soupy, you didn't cook it long enough or your measurements were off. I've scaled this recipe up, scaled it down, and each time it has turned out great. It does take time though so if you don't have much of it, skip this recipe. It's a staple in our household now and I'm making a double batch for dinner tonight. I'm salivating as I read this. Mmmm. Great stuff here.
This recipe is great I cooked it like 15 times
I made this for 40 people and it turned out amazing. The only change that I made was cut the water back to a total of 6 cups.
I'm sure these are very tasty but please rename them :-( Why wouldn't you call them SLOPPY JOHNS?? Joes of the world unite!! #loosemeatsandwiches
I love this recipe! I only changed 1 thing. Instead of adding a cup at the end I added a cup of BBQ sauce. It made it rich and delicious!

I've made this several times and it is good. I never thought that all that water would be absorbed but it does with a little patience. I have since made it using a red pepper instead of a green one, added some bbq sauce and a small amount of diced celery to give it some crunch. Great recipe!

I reduced the brown sugar to 1 T and added a dash or two of smoked paprika. This recipe and technique were delicious and well appreciated! I will mark this one as the ONLY one for Sloppy Joe's cravings!
Thank you.
Very tasty. I'll make these every time.

I scaled Chef John's recipe down to one pound of ground Beef and it came out perfectly!
I used Sweet Mini Bells Peppers, `cuz that's what I had on hand.
Served it up with Hot Cherry Pepper slices, Potato Chips and Pickles.
YUM!
This dish is now in our regular rotation.

Recipe was great a real solid hit. 

I used red onion. 
I added a 1/2 tsp of Smoke to give is more southern flavor.

It's a 10 not a 5!!!!!
Always the best with Chef John. Thank you for the recipe. Made as written and oh so good!

I made it as the recipe was written except I decreased the brown sugar to 1 TBSP as I am very sensitive to sweet. 
Next time I'll cut the ketchup to 1/4 cup (it's sweet to my taste) and eliminate the brown sugar altogether as it was too 'ketchupy' and sweet for me. Otherwise a good easy recipe that I'll make again for my grandchildren.

My wife does not like peppers (ugh!) but I followed the recipe to the letter otherwise. It is delicious and excellent as a leftover! I also tried it with pork which worked just as well. Chef John does it again!

This is a great recipe! it tastes just like the canned stuff but so much better. It's easy to make and simple ingredients used that you should have already, you do need to let it cook for 40-45 min. to get that thickness, but it's all worth it and i have made this recipe a few times with no fails!

This is the best sloppy joe's recipe hands down. I did have to simmer longer than was called for to cook down. The only reason for 4 stars is my go to quick meal is sloppy joe's, I buy the sauce for $1 and it is ready in less than 30 minutes.

Another great Chef John recipe! I had to make changes based on what I had on hand, but the basic recipe is what made my dinner delicious. I used 1 lb ground beef and 8 oz chopped button mushrooms (cut the added water by at least 1/3 cup). I only had about 1/2 red pepper, so supplemented with 2 chopped pickled cherry peppers and a bunch of chopped pickled banana peppers. I also added a good "splog" of tomato paste and anchovy paste after the meat, onion, and mushroom cooked for a minute or so before the set next steps. I prefer tangy over sweet so halved the brown sugar and replaced 1/3 cup of water with some of the pickled pepper juice. We loved it and will definitely make it again soon.
I found this recipe has too much water. I note others have found the same. Halve the H2O and you're set.

This was a great base to start from; I used Chef John's recipe to spring board. (Replaced half the ketchup with canned crushed tomatoes in rich sauce, used less brown sugar.) I like the ability to increase the number of servings on the app. I bumped it up to 50 servings and then tripled it. We served 170 at Soup Kitchen with this recipe!!
This is perfect , have made it several times...Sometimes I add wine or unsalted beef broth for the water
I've made this several times and loved it each time! I have gotten several compliments and requests for the recipe, which I gladly share. You have to cook the liquid out
In our house, this recipe has been elevated to Untidy Joseph’s!
My wife loved it. I followed the recipe but added red peppers and a few jalapeños for heat. Very good and freezes well.
Wowwwww
Made this last weekend and even though we ate it on wheat bread slices it was still great.

used red bell pepper otherwise followed recipe had to cook about a hour to thicken properly very tasty and delicious 
Kelly Syracuse NY
Omg we loved this recipe!!!! It’s now a family favorite and we will make it again and again. I served it with home fries and it was the perfect comfort meal.

I really like most of Chef John's recipes and this is no exception. I made a couple of minor adjustments. 

1. I swap in canned tomato juice (like V8) instead of water. its a ton of extra flavor when it reduces. Reduced sodium is fine if that's a concern.

2. I use 4-5 miniature sweet peppers instead of one bell pepper. flavor is similar but not quite as strong.

It's delicious and my daughter requests it all the time. Warning: I am not allowed to buy the canned Sloppy Joe mix anymore.
Yum!
Make it as written it's the best sloppy Joe, there is!
Yum! Very tasty.

I have been making this recipe for about 5 years. those of you that say it is soupy should really just follow the instructions. you need a large pan. and do not cover it, you need the liquid to evaporate, yes it takes a while but well worth it.

I also tweak it to my taste using the ingredients to the recipe. this is sooo yummy. thanks chef John!

Excellent! As others have noted, simmer until the liquid is gone. Watch Chef John's video, it's really clear on how to make it perfect. The only change I made to this is I added Stubb's Spicy BBQ Sauce instead of Ketchup. There hasn't been ketchup in my house in over 40 years, too much sodium and sugar for my tastes. I made a big batch of the Sloppy Joe recipe and froze enough for a few more Joe's. Thanks Chef John!

This is my go to recipe for sloppy Joes. Great taste exactly the way it is, and it freezes great! I like to keep a batch in the freezer for times when I have to unexpectedly feed fussy grandkids since it’s the only thing they all love. Make sure to let it simmer and get to the right consistency. As with many recipes, it tastes better the longer it cooks, and even better the next day.
Best one ever!

This is a new favorite. We were sick of the manwich stuff and really craving some "old school" sloppy joes (or, as my north Dakotan husband called them - "barbecues"). Whatever they are - they always hit the spot - and yes - add tots!! I am, after all, the Margaret Cho of my Sloppy Joe!

The best sloppy joe ever, because I have a large family I doubled the ingredients. I added a red bell pepper with the green and added KC barbecue sauce with the ketchup. I’ll never use canned sloppy joe sauce ever again; thank you Chef.
No changes, delicious, will be making again.

Our family loves this recipe! With 3 changes: 1) We use ground lamb instead of beef 2) celery instead of bell pepper and 3) half the amount of brown sugar. Chef John is one of our favorites so it’s no surprise that my family loves this too. Thanks John!

Great recipe! Followed advice of some others who had made this before me and I left out the water. I only had 1lb of beef and only used 3tbsp water total but otherwise followed the recipe exactly and it came out thick and delicious. It’s so yummy, thank you Chef John.

WAY, WAY too much water! I only added one cup of water and had to cook for quite a long time before it cooked down and resembled Sloppy Joe consistency. How they can describe this as "almost dry" is beyond me. The flavor was great, though, so I'll use this recipe again, but I'll start out with a half cup to three-fourths cup of water and see how that goes.
blahhhh....its okay , simple but very bland. Cant compete with any of the major canned sloppy Joe's, by a mile. Not worth your time.
Such a simple recipe with big nostalgic taste! Served with tater tots to bring back childhood memories!

Really good. Takes a long time compared to making sloppy joes from a can, but tastes better.

I used spicy mustard and about 2 tablespoons of it. Instead of ketchup, I used around two cups of BBQ sauce (KC Masterpiece). Also, did not use the green pepper.

Make sure to use lean ground beef, I used 85/15 and there was too much fat/liquid in the pan after I broke up/browned the ground beef. Had to remove it before I added the water and spices/sauce.

Turned out very good. Try to microwave buns for 20-30 seconds before plating and serve like an open face sandwhich.
So much better than the canned version. My family really liked it.
Excellent, no changes made.

Chef John does it again!
I've made a handful of his recipes now, and all have been easy, delicious, and delicious 
My wife and I love garlic so we used a lot more Ha!
Thanks, Chef John - you're awesome!
easy, usually have all the ingredients on hand, and quick. Did not change a thing except to omit the cayenne. The family does not like cayenne.
First time so I made it exactly as written. My husband actually did the “mmm” thing for the whole sandwich. Perfect!
It was a sweet dish , not that great.

only change I made was used ground chicken breast instead to lower fat content. this was a great recipe. only calls for one cup of water in ingredients but in directions calls for two? I only used one and it simmered down just fine.
This was definitely too watery, I would probably cut back on the water and drain the beef/onions after cooking next time. But the flavor is 100% there.
very good
awesome!!
Husband loves this. It’s too sweet for me but easy to adjust. I’ll use more tomato sauce or paste ( probably a mixture to mimic ketchup consistency) and less ketchup . Definitely a keeper.

As always, Chef John does it again. This was perfect. Don’t worry if it looks soupy at first, keep it at a simmer until all the liquid is absorbed and you won’t be disappointed. These sloppy joe’s stay on your bun, just be patient and cook it down.

Best sloppy joes ever! I’m not kidding. 
When I was a kid I always had Manwich. Then I grew up, tried it again and couldn’t wait because I remembered it was soooo good. It’s was NOT. as I remembered. 
I followed to the letter with the exception of the cayenne. I added more because I like spicy. It came out thick and held together and had amazing flavor. The combo of the brown sugar and the cayenne was to die for. I never thought I’d get to say, I love sloppy joes! Again.
Prepared as directed and it was wonderful!

I made this and CJs hamburger buns. These were pretty incredible. I did make some adjustments to my needs: 1#beef, 1#turkey, half a red bell pepper and 2 jalapeno, 1.5 cups sliced mushrooms, onion powder. Aside from that- used the same technique and exact measurements for the sauce. Perfection and that bun really makes it toe-curling good. Served with pickles and slice red onion.
These were by far the best sloppy joes I’ve ever had. Hubby thought so too. Followed the recipe exactly. They had to cook done far longer than the 45 minutes though, closer to an hour and a half.

Delicious, made as is pretty much. Only had a pound of ground beef so cut water down to 2/3 cup each time and ketchup down to 1/2 cup and brown sugar down to 1.5ish tbsp. Only had half a yellow bell pepper so used that. Cooked up in my cast iron skillet, super easy and happy eaters all around!
This recipe is great. Didn’t change a thing and everyone love it. Will definitely make again.
Savory, not like a soupy ketchup sauce. You can pick these up without spilling too much. Fam loved them.

I followed the recipe exactly because I trust Chef John’s recipes and instructions immensely!! You have to let it simmer to reduce the liquid as stated -- don’t give up, it will happen! Perfect recipe and flavour. We all loved it!
This is a phenomenal sloppy joe. Chef John is the BEST!

This was very good. I submitted red pepper instead of green pepper one time and then made it without either the next. I also reduced the brown sugar to 1 Tbl both times. I used a little bit of hot sauce instead of cayenne pepper and my family loves it. Definitely will make again.
Absolutely wonderful! No leftovers. My granddaughter ate two sandwiches and took another to her boyfriend!!! Hubby didn’t complain at all! A success!!

Looked for a good sloppy Joe recipe for my picky kids. Always relied on Chef John's recipes! Just a minor adjustment and it's according to everyone's taste... half the brown sugar since ketchup is a little sweet. Other than that.. yummy!

I have made this recipe lots of times now. I have it changed up a bit though. Here are my changes to this recipe; 
700gms of Lean Ground Beef. 
1 whole onion
1 cup ketchup Heinz only
2 tblsp brown sugar packed
1 tblsp mustard
1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
1 cup of water
3 cloves garlic
1/2 Red pepper
1-2 tsp salt to taste
1/2 tsp Cayenne

Cook ground beef in large frying pan till a little pink remains. Strain off excess fat but not all. In a separate pan cook onions and garlic. Combine garlic/onions once fat is drained. Then add red pepper cook for one minute. Add remaining ingredients except salt/pepper/cayenne. Add only one cup of water. After bringing to a boil of Medium heat, reduce and simmer. After 10mins add 1tsp or less of salt, add pepper. After another 10mins taste. Add salt and or
Pepper to taste, also add cayenne. Taste once more when almost cooked and add salt/pepper/cayenne to taste. Turn off heat and then lightly toast butter buns for better flavor. I use mini Ciabatta for mine.

Loved it! I followed the directions to a tee and was very pleasantly surprised by the mix of flavors and the little hot pepper kick at the end. The sweet and hot kick really made the sloppy Joe. I also loved that it wasn't "sloppy" like Mamwich. Like others said about letting it simmer. I was certain it would be to watery but after 45 minutes it was nice and thick. Patience guys, good things come to those who wait! Thanks chef John, I'll definitely be making more of your recipes.

This is an amazing recipe! There is NO need to change anything. You will have to be patient though and let the liquid cook down and when it is done, you will taste it was worth the wait. YUMMY x 1000! Thanks Chef John, you never let me down!
We put it over spaghetti and everyone one loved it in my very picky family. I find almost every Chef Johns recipies my family loves.

Very, very good, Chef John!! Even my picky teenagers loved it! I had no peppers in the house, so I used a can of mild chiles. It was very good, despite my hesitation to use KETCHUP instead of tomato paste. Thanks!
You will not use Manwhich again. So yummy.
This is my go-to recipe for sloppy Joe's. The only change I make is leaving out the second cup of water. It comes out perfect without it.
Great recipe! I used ground turkey and added about a tablespoon of chili powder.
This one's a keeper. Made it several times.
My husband is very picky about his sloppy joes and he loves this recipe.
Followed recipe exactly and it was great! We have a bread maker so my husband made homemade buns and boy what a tasty combination!

Followed chef John's recipe. Took closer to an hour to reduce down but worth the wait, so will plan for that next time. Use fresh buns, wonderful flavour. Right about the sweet and heat, don't add to much cayenne, just enough to taste a little heat. Might kick it up a notch next time by melting mozza over the open face sandwich.

For sloppy joe 's I used Bennetts Chili Sauce, but it is not available anymore. This is it!! It tastes exactly (maybe even a little better) than Bennetts. I used red instead of green pepper just because of personal preference. It is sweet, but I like it that way, so you can start with 1 Tbls. brown sugar and adjust to taste. Also, after reading all the reviews, you MUST let it cook down for 30-60 minutes on medium heat and it will be the perfect texture. My family and I loved it! Thanks Chef John I've been searching for quite awhile and you've got a winner SJ!!

Very tasty. I used a red bell pepper because that's what I had, I also added a teaspoon of apple cider vinegar at the end of cooking as someone else suggested. It complemented the dish nicely. We like to eat our sloppy joes open-faced on a toasted onion bun with shredded cheddar and fresh onion. They were great, but I did miss the thick Manwich sauce.

It's a great recipe as is (I doubled it for leftovers to bring to work). However, if you want it to taste a bit closer to the canned sloppy joe sauce, add tomato paste to taste. I serve it over rice and it's very tasty!
My sons loved it! I didn’t have a green pepper so I substituted 3 small sweet peppers. I accidentally added 1 tablespoon of Dijon, but was very tasty.
just what i was looking for!
The best sloppy Joe recipe I have made. I add a little bit of liquid smoke and cut back slightly on the green pepper.
I make this easily once a week! My hubby loves this!
